item.title: Old code and old tools
item.description: One of the problems with old codebases is that they are missing modern tooling for automated builds, automated testing, and the like. A second problem with old code is that the maintainers (absent modern tooling) may not know or recognize what dependencies they have. If an old package is not mostly self-contained, it’s likely to have dependencies on other old code. This makes it hard to build, as those older dependencies have either gone offline or have mutated so that the old package doesn’t work with the new releases.
